Short description: Evidence type based on the potential clinical actionability of the variant in a given disease.
Complete description: Evidence type based on the potential clinical actionability of the variant in given disease. Three types of clinical significance evidences are available according to guidelines. Predictive (therapeutic): variant that indicates sensitivity or resistance to a specific therapy. Prognostic: variant that predicts the course of a disease.Diagnostic: variant that supports the diagnosis of a disease.  Also See Pathogenicity for more details.

Short description: List still to be worked out
Complete description: Consequence of the variant observed during a clinical or functional investigation.

Short description: Level of pathogenicity or actionability of a variant as defined by AMP/ASCO/CAPS guidelines
Complete description: Level of pathogenicity or actionability of a variant as defined by AMP/ASCO/CAPS guidelines. Precise => Tier criteria table to provide

Short description: Additional information for the interpretation of the variant provided during the curation/review process
Complete description: Additional information for the interpretation of the variant provided during the curation/review process

Short description: Curator/reviewer confidence of the published evidences (strong, moderate, low)
Complete description: Curator/reviewer confidence of the published evidences, based on three levels: strong, moderate, low
Pubmed ID, DOI or other type of reference used for the interpretation of the variant pathogenicity and actionability.
